Wow, keeping a consistent design across new art is really hard!
Oh, wait, no it isn't.

Because they've changed her design. Intentionally.

They wanted her to look more like a fencer. And in terms of costume, the new one looks more rich posh aristocrat fencer than the old one. The hair covering the eye looks better in terms of "sex appeal", but doesn't make sense for who she is: a focused fighter who always pays attention to her opponent's weakspots. Her face needs tweaking on the current splash. Her models need a bit of work. That's about it.

> [{quoted}](name=TheTyeGuy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EABFsxAZ,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-22T16:28:25.881+0000)

Her face needs tweaking on the current splash. Her models need a bit of work. That's about it.

I can also argue that she has her hair in front of the face to purposefully diminish her vision as to give the enemy an advantage as she is, and I quote, "Looking for a worthy opponent"

Yet believes herself to be the best and an artist with a blade, meaning the only way she could get a challenge is if she handicaps herself (kinda like Jax with the lamp)

So yeah in my opinion a pompous prideful girl like this would dress pretty, be pretty and fight pretty

deliberately obscuring your vision doesn't make your opponent worthy.

fooling them into thinking you're left HANDED though...

I have something to tell you, too!

I'm not left handed, either!

the hair over the face makes her mysterious/imperious. She's supposed to be prideful and a bit arrogant. fighting even with the handicap of vision blocking hair and even looking like she's giving you a handicap while doing it is the point.

The softer features gives her more charm and elegance over the current splash and overall makes her look gorgeous in comparison to her current villainy splash.

Rito, for the love of god, please listen to the community for once.

Don't "put it into consideration," don't "send our regards to the X or Y teams," don't "send it to PBE but never do anything,"

*just listen to us for once.*

*This is not a gameplay balancing issue that requires degrees and experience and testing to make decisions for.*

*This concerns the art and model of a character that the player is supposed to enjoy and love from a cosmetic perspective.*

*Listen.*

*To.*

*Your.*

*Consumers.*

> _To._

> _Your._

> _Consumers._

_Boards._

_The._

_Majority._

 This is >1% of the consumer base, and often the most radical minority. If the playerbase were actually mad these threads would be a whole lot bigger.

Most people aren't going on the forum to tell Riot how great the splash is. This is the standard they have set that I and most people I know expect, and personally, I like it.
But there are people who go on the forum to whinge about the new splash which is TOTALLY fine, but they seriously shouldn't have such a sharp tongue about it. The splash artist makes the thing representing the work everyone's done, publishes the thing "DAng I hope people like the art",
they go to check out feedback and BaDA BIng
"ugly"
"looks like the same thing but less talented"
"gross angular face"
I wouldn't be surprised if they took a couple days away from the forum for their own sake.

If getting told that your art looks bad makes you take a holiday, I highly suggest you get out of the habit of making art, because this will happen every time, even if it's a masterpiece.

> [{quoted}](name=Noin Lucrezia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EABFsxAZ,comment-id=002d0000000000010000,timestamp=2015-07-23T07:23:15.631+0000)

Waiting until the "OMG. CHANGE! MAKE IT GO AWAY" sentiment has died down in order to then evaluate actually constructive criticism can actually be a very good idea.
Regardless of whether a change is good or bad, this natural bias against change makes it almost impossible to really evaluate peoples' opinion until they got at least somewhat used to it.

> [{quoted}](name=TrulyBland,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EABFsxAZ,comment-id=002d00000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-07-23T07:34:22.130+0000)
>
> Waiting until the "OMG. CHANGE! MAKE IT GO AWAY" sentiment has died down in order to then evaluate actually constructive criticism can actually be a very good idea.
> Regardless of whether a change is good or bad, this natural bias against change makes it almost impossible to really evaluate peoples' opinion until they got at least somewhat used to it.

So, rather than telling them that we don't like it, when it matters and can be changed early on, you'd prefer if we shut up and wait until it's too late? Are we not allowed to not like things? So what if it's different. That doesn't mean any opinions are invalid.

You're like one of those "How can you know it sucks if you don't play it?" "Wow, if it sucks so much why did you play it for 10 hours?" guys.

What am I going to get used to? My favourite Champion being able to cut glass with her jaw? Her new models being shit? The part where the top of her head is flat like a table? The terrible hairstyle that removed _the most unique thing about Fiora_?

Waiting won't make me like this shit any more. I'd rather tell them early on so they know it sucks here and now. I'm so sick and tired of everyone defending everything with bullshit like "Oh it's too new to tell!"
It's aesthetics, not gameplay. You don't need to let it sink in that long. It's been over 24 hours.

> [{quoted}](name=Noin Lucrezia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EABFsxAZ,comment-id=002d000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-23T08:35:50.984+0000)
>
> So, rather than telling them that we don't like it, when it matters and can be changed early on, you'd prefer if we shut up and wait until it's too late? Are we not allowed to not like things? So what if it's different. That doesn't mean any opinions are invalid.
> 
> You're like one of those "How can you know it sucks if you don't play it?" "Wow, if it sucks so much why did you play it for 10 hours?" guys.
> 
> What am I going to get used to? My favourite Champion being able to cut glass with her jaw? Her new models being shit? The part where the top of her head is flat like a table? The terrible hairstyle that removed _the most unique thing about Fiora_?
> 
> Waiting won't make me like this shit any more. I'd rather tell them early on so they know it sucks here and now. I'm so sick and tired of everyone defending everything with bullshit like "Oh it's too new to tell!"
> It's aesthetics, not gameplay. You don't need to let it sink in that long. It's been over 24 hours.

And that kind of constructive and precise criticism you offer is still absolutely rare in the forums. THAT'S the point. Not that the opinions are invalid or that you're not allowed to have an opinion, or even that you should shut up now. Case in point, you of all people maybe should be talking even more, seeing as you are able to express your criticism (even if it is a tad agressive).

But the vast majority of peoples' main argument is still just that it's not the way it used to be, and that's not the least bit constructive. Until the percentage of arguments have dropped below a certain threshold it's difficult for Riot to assess how many people *actually* dislike it and why they dislike it.
Especially because the forums are **not** a random sample of players, and thus are **not** a good representation of the playerbase.

I don't particularly care for the lighting color choice, but I could live with it, but I think it needs to be toned down so you can actually see the window's design. I feel as though the gold light rays contrast incredibly poorly with her outfit. Looking at her torso, the lighting is just all over the place. Realistic or not I'm not entirely sure, it still looks very "everywhere"

Hair's also yay and eh. You ever wear your hair like that? It's not comfortable and it doesn't sit right, especially in motion. However I do like the design and coloring of it more than the current. 

Face is MUCH better than the current new splash though, by far.

I agree. She's a grand duelist who can spot enemies vital spots. How is she supposed to spot their vitals with hair in her face? The hair in her face look just makes me think she's an emo kid not worth taking seriously.

What Riot did to Fiora's hair makes sense though.

She's a fencer. She doesn't want her hair covering her eyes during a fight.

Also the filter is unnecessary.

Really the only thing that needed fixing were the hard lines on her face.
Following that logic most champions should be basically bald. {{champion:55}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:55}}

Katarina isn't a refined duelist though. She's a merciless dagger spinning flippy floopy assassin.

Riven uses a gigantic sword, so she doesn't really go for accuracy.

Irelia's hair does not cover her eyes.

Neither does akali's hair.

Changed the eye --- I'm bad no h8
http://i.imgur.com/7IdIOBG.png

Seeing stuff like this makes it even more sad that Riot don't really care...
There you go, she's fixed. They won't care.
{{champion:114}} this is much more better. The new fiora just like fiora's mother!!

Yes, Yes, Yes. A thousand times Yes... - Fiora

Riot, I pray, I really do pray / wish / desire / want / need that you read my comment, and all the other comments popping up, not even about Fiora's new Kit, which is what we're playing with now, because she will be a true skilled duellist now.
The ONLY complaints are from the splash art(s), and the HIDEOUS ingame models...
IF you need pointers, here are some put together:
-The new splash did remind me of Cruella from Disney for some reason, I wasn't too surprised when I noticed so many other people felt the same.
-LOOK at her "old" Royal Guard splash art... Look at her classic splash art.
Look at her "old" in game models.
THAT'S Fiora... Round faced, charismatic and characteristic eyebrows, "large" jaw, the look in her eyes... Her mouth expressions. This is her evil sister... Did my Fiora get murdered? For example, the "new" Headmistress looks AWFUL, the "old" one just needed to have her neck length toned down a bit. That's all...

What you could do visually was simply, give her a color fixer-upper, and trim some edges here and there. Not throw a box of botox and scizzors at her face. Jesus...
The new Kit is LOVELY Riot. But don't kill my freaking main champion by giving her an unnecessary and very aesthetically unpleasing visual (un)update...

Thank you... And please. Listen to us.
{{champion:114}}
